meanings.definition: To sacrifice or kill as a religious offering
meanings.sent1: The priest immolates the goat during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization would immolate animals to please their gods.
meanings.sent3: The chicken immolates itself to become a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: The flames immolate the wooden structure, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The act of immolating symbolizes devotion and reverence in their culture.

meanings.definition: To kill or destroy by fire
meanings.sent1: The arsonist immolates the building in a fit of rage.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire can immolate entire forests in a matter of hours.
meanings.sent3: The dragon immolates the village with its fiery breath.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat immolates everything in its path, leaving nothing but charred remains.
meanings.sent5: The flames dance and immolate everything in their path, consuming all in their fiery embrace.

meanings.sent1: The devotee immolates fruits and flowers at the altar.
meanings.sent2: In some traditions, believers immolate food as an offering to their deities.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully immolates the burnt toast as a sacrifice to the breakfast gods.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ritual immolates the sacred herbs to invoke blessings from the spirits.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of incense fills the air as they immolate their offerings to the divine.
